title: ASL 2.6 ‚Äî Daily Routines & DO-DO? üîÅ
objectives: Use time-first order to describe daily routines (morning/afternoon/night)
Combine routine verbs (WAKE-UP, BRUSH-TEETH, EAT, GO, STUDY/WORK, HOMEWORK, SLEEP) with places
Ask/answer routine questions with YES/NO NMM and DO-DO? (WH-face) clearly

vocab.def: EAT taps at mouth; meals with time context.
STUDY sparkles on palm; WORK fists tap; HOME + WORK combined.
Open hand closes at face as head dips slightly.
Place time at the beginning for clarity (e.g., TODAY MORNING‚Ä¶).

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Time ‚Üí Routine Strip
sections.body: Sign **MORNING / AFTERNOON / NIGHT**. Add one verb each: **MORNING WAKE-UP**, **AFTERNOON STUDY**, **NIGHT SLEEP**. Keep movements small; pause briefly after time.

microCheck.q: Where should time go in most ASL sentences for routines?

callouts.title: Ergonomics
callouts.body: Neutral wrist; tiny rests every 5‚Äì7 minutes.

callouts.title: Eye Gaze
callouts.body: Receivers look at the **face**; signers keep motions centered at torso.

sections.heading: Model: Build a Routine Line

media.alt: MORNING I WAKE-UP. THEN BRUSH-TEETH. AFTERNOON I STUDY SCHOOL. NIGHT I SLEEP HOME.
media.caption: Time-first + short clauses

sections.body:
Use **TIME ‚Üí PRONOUN ‚Üí VERB ‚Üí PLACE**. Examples:
‚Ä¢ **MORNING I WAKE-UP. THEN BRUSH-TEETH.**
‚Ä¢ **AFTERNOON I STUDY SCHOOL.**
‚Ä¢ **NIGHT I SLEEP HOME.** Keep clauses 3‚Äì5 signs for clarity.

microCheck.q: Which order is most natural for routines?

sections.teacherNote: Coach a micro-pause after the time chunk; encourage steady tempo.

sections.heading: Questions: YES/NO vs DO-DO?
sections.body:
**YES/NO (brows up):** **TONIGHT YOU HOMEWORK?**  
**WH (brows down):** **TONIGHT YOU DO-DO?**  
Answers short: **I HOMEWORK.** / **I NOT HOMEWORK.**

callouts.title: Frames
callouts.body: YES/NO: **MORNING YOU EAT?** ‚Üí **YES. BREAKFAST.**  WH: **AFTERNOON YOU DO-DO?** ‚Üí **STUDY SCHOOL.**

sections.teacherNote: Mirror drill: pause to feel the NMM difference; add tiny head tilt for YES/NO.

sections.heading: Partner Loop: My Day
sections.body: A asks **TODAY MORNING YOU DO-DO?** ‚Üí B answers **WAKE-UP, BRUSH-TEETH.**  A asks **AFTERNOON YOU GO WHERE?** ‚Üí **SCHOOL.** Switch roles. Keep answers 3‚Äì5 signs.

callouts.title: Feedback Stem
callouts.body: ‚ÄúTry time-first, small pause, then verb. WH-face a bit stronger on DO-DO.‚Äù

microCheck.q: Best follow-up to a vague answer like ‚ÄúGO‚Äù?

sections.teacherNote: Differentiate with routine icon cards; allow seated practice.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **10‚Äì15s**: 2 routine statements + 1 question (YES/NO or DO-DO?). Example: **MORNING I WAKE-UP. AFTERNOON I STUDY SCHOOL. TONIGHT YOU DO-DO?**
sections.teacherNote: Offer privacy submission; ask for a caption noting **time-first** and **NMM control**.

items.q: Correct NMM for YES/NO routine questions:
Write an ASL gloss: MORNING I WAKE-UP. THEN BRUSH-TEETH. NIGHT I SLEEP HOME.

items.prompt: Which was harder‚Äîtime-first pausing or NMM switching (YES/NO vs WH)? What will you drill next?
